summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The inmate, whose name is redacted, provides observations about the night of Epstein's death, the guards' actions, and the condition of the cell and body. The report also notes the inmate had additional information about contraband and inappropriate staff behavior.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JEFF' by the interviewee; the inmate describes the discovery of his death, his activities on the day before, and observations of his body.

persons.name: Stone
persons.context: Described as Jeffrey Epstein's cell mate; was taken to court on the Friday before Epstein's death and did not return that night.

persons.name: Lt. Doctor
persons.context: Asked questions and took notes during the interview with the inmate; the FBI agent served as translator for them.

connections.description: Were cell mates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Lt. Doctor was interviewing an inmate to gather information about Epstein's death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The inmate witness describes the discovery during breakfast/head count, the guards' response, and observations of the body.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein was taken to legal meetings from approximately 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. His cell mate, Stone, was taken to court and did not return that night.

events.title: FBI Interview of MCC Inmate
events.description: An FBI agent interviews an inmate at the MCC regarding Epstein's death. The inmate provides observations about the night, the guards, and the body.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: An inmate witness stated the last guard check on Epstein's tier was between 12:30 AM and 1:00 AM, and that guards did not perform proper rounds.
The inmate observed that when Epstein's body was discovered, the rope was not over his head, he had bruising on his face, and earphones were still in place.
Epstein's cell mate, Stone, was taken to court on the day before Epstein's death and did not return to the cell that night.
The inmate claimed to have other information regarding contraband and inappropriate behavior between staff counselors and inmates at the MCC.
The inmate initially stated he wanted his lawyer present but continued to offer information about Epstein's death anyway.
